snippet: Coach Yoshihiro Uchida, 92, built the San Jose State judo program into a national power and has almost single-handedly elevated the stature and visibility of the sport in the United States.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column profiles 92-year-old Japanese-American Yoshihiro Uchida, who has been coaching judo at San Jose State University for 66 years; notes that Uchida built the San Jose State judo program into a national power, winning 45 championships in 51 years, and has almost single-handedly elevated the stature and visibility of the sport in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Coach Yoshihiro Uchida, 92, built the San Jose State judo program into a national power and has almost single-handedly elevated the stature and visibility of the sport in the United States.

headline.seo: Yoshihiro Uchida Has Coached Judo for 66 Years at San Jose St.
headline.main: For 66 Years, a Force for Judo in the United States
headline.print_headline: For 66 Years, a Force for Judo In the United States
